description: From Arabic غَازٍ‎ (ḡāzin), active participle of غَزَا‎ (ḡazā, “to raid”).

entries.meaning: A Muslim warrior who fights in war against non-Muslims, especially one who has won renown as a martial champion; often used as a title.
examples: I should have fallen into the hands of the murderous Ghazis had it not been for the devotion and courage shown by Murray, my orderly, who threw me across a pack-horse, and succeeded in bringing me safely to the British lines.
